channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Europe Begins to Ask if Syrians Can Go Home After al-Assad’s Fall
item.description: Nearly a million Syrians in Germany alone have made new lives. But after the fall of Bashar al-Assad, some politicians across the continent have sugge...

item.title: Senate begins final push to give Social Security benefits to 2.8 more million people in move that would further strain fund
item.description: The bill would add an estimated $195 billion to federal deficits over 10 years, according to the Congressional Budget Office.

item.title: UnitedHealth Group C.E.O.: Brian Thompson Was Never Content With the Status Quo
item.description: No one would design a system like the one we have. And no one did.

item.title: Syria After al-Assad’s Overthrow: What’s Happening and What Comes Next
item.description: Rebels are asserting control in Damascus as Israel and other countries carry out military operations.

item.title: Israel Says Its Troops Will Stay in Seized Territory for Now

item.title: Suspect in UnitedHealthcare CEO murder wasn’t a client of the insurer, police say
item.description: Luigi Mangione was not a client of the medical insurer and may have targeted it because of its size and influence, a senior police official said.

item.title: As Volkswagen workers strike in Germany over pay cuts, carmaker offers Tennesse workers 14% wage hike
item.description: Volkswagen is struggling to satisfy workers on both sides of the Atalntic Ocean amid need for aggressive cost cuts.
